Machine Learning Engineer Internship, Computer Vision - US Remote
Project Engineer
description: About the Voith Group The Voith Group is a global technology company. With its broad portfolio of systems, products, services and digital applications, Voith sets standards in the markets of energy, paper, raw materials and transport & automotive. Founded in 1867, the company today has around 21,000 employees, sales of € 4.9 billion and locations in over 60 countries worldwide and is thus one of the larger family-owned companies in Europe. Voith Paper is hiring for: ** *Engineer I, Projects* West Monroe, LA Interested to learn about Voith? Check out our video on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6xOifeDxLac ** *Reasons you’ll love working here:* Flexibility with Work/Life Balance Hybrid Schedule and Summer Hours Dress for Your Day Dress Code Great Compensation and Benefits Package including 401K with up to 5% Match AND a 3% Company Contribution to Start Paid Time Off and 10 paid Holidays per Year Climate-Neutral Footprint Worldwide Leadership and Professional Development Opportunities Health and Wellness Benefits ** *Career development:* Plan on developing both professionally and personally. Voith Learning & Development, team creates classes, seminars, and beyond-the-classroom tools that help employees understand Voith’s culture, organization, values, and role in the world. Benefits: Our range of offered benefits can include medical, dental, vision, life insurances, starting on first of month, employee discounts, 401(k) savings plans, service awards, tuition reimbursement, referral bonuses and more! Find out which benefits you'll get after you choose your role with us. ** *Life work balance:* Paid time off starting at 16 days in your first year of employment plus 10 paid holidays. ** *Summary* The project design engineer provides design efforts from inception through production both in new product design and in existing product redesign. The Engineer II uses existing procedures to solve routine or standard problems. The Engineer II receives instruction, guidance and direction from others needing a moderate level of guidance and direction. Meets all criteria required of Project Engineer I. ** *Principal Responsibilities* Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Maintain customer, job and drawing files per Engineering Department Standards. Ability to search for documents, OEM drawings, West Monroe engineered drawings and resources on Share Point Site. Produce manufacturing drawings of repairs, replacement parts, etc. using customary methods and/or industry standards for machining. Review customer source control drawings, specification control drawings and other applicable specifications to determine requirements and/or feasibility of the component. Perform all necessary calculations such as stress analysis and as required in the review of inspections, as it relates to bearing fits, shell/head fits, seal fits, flinger fits, etc. Prepare preliminary design proposal(s). Interact with mechanical personnel to define and solve manufacturing/design issues and implement cost reduction ideas with regard to company products. Perform liaison function between customers, sales group, engineering and all mechanical services operations for any related issues, problems or improvements. Work with the quality department sales and others to define problem areas and implement product improvements based on customer repair/rejection concerns. Participate in engineering and general design review as required. Prepare proposal documentation. Prepare technical data such as standard customer reports and special reports when needed. Interact with customers on engineering design and any questions/problems they may have. Interact with vendors concerning parts they supply or propose to supply to company. Coordinate as required with internal groups including purchasing, quality control, sales, mechanical shop, cover production and accounting personnel. Review job cost sheets and update sales order as necessary to provide accurate final sales amount for final invoice to customer. During review of job cost sheets observe the gross margin amount of job and if possible provide explanation of jobs closing. Keep supervisor advised of work status, workload, problems and progress as related to work assignments. ** *Knowledge/Skills/Abilities/Competencies* Must be able to demonstrate: effective collaboration (teamwork) skills familiarity with basic concepts and procedures technical capacity excellent written and verbal communication skills ability to multi-task based on business need excellent time management skills basic knowledge of OPEX procedures basic knowledge of paper machine rolls basic knowledge of the paper making process basic knowledge of the different sections of paper machines basic knowledge of cover manufacturing basic knowledge of paper machine upgrades developed by FRS Technology and Optimization, regarding the design, function and application of the upgrades (Current examples: Hydroseal, Tracklight, EvoTrim, Seal Wear Monitoring Systems ** *Work Environment* This position will primarily be located in a standard work environment. Occasional field or customer site visits will be required. ** *Required Education and Experience* Bachelor of engineering degree from four-year accredited college or university OR a combination of equivalent, relevant experience may be considered in lieu of college degree Requires a minimum of five (5) years of relevant manufacturing, engineering or mechanical experience ** *Work Authorization/Security Clearance* This position is not eligible for sponsorship. ** *Other Duties* Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. ** *Physical Demands* The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. Don’t meet every single requirement but think you would be a good fit for our team? We encourage you to apply – your unique skills may be just what we need for this or other roles! __ _Voith US Inc. is an EEO/AA/VEVRAA compliant Federal Contractor and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. We welcome everyone to apply, especially those individuals who are underrepresented in the industry including people of color, LGBTQI+ community, women, individuals with disabilities (both seen and unseen), Veterans, people of any age or family status. We embrace the competitive advantage that diversity brings and we strive to create a working environment that is inclusive of thought and talent._ Job Type: Full-time Ability to Commute: West Monroe, LA (Required) Work Location: In person

title: Marine Engineer
description: Company Profile Oceaneering is a global provider of engineered services and products, primarily to the offshore energy industry. We develop products and services for use throughout the lifecycle of an offshore oilfield, from drilling to decommissioning. We operate the world's premier fleet of work class ROVs. Additionally, we are a leader in offshore oilfield maintenance services, umbilicals, subsea hardware, and tooling. We also use applied technology expertise to serve the defense, entertainment, material handling, aerospace, science, and renewable energy industries. Position Summary Responsible for the planning and execution of maintenance and equipment on vessels within the regulatory compliance, budget, and policy constraints of the Marine department. Duties & Responsibilities Inspect marine equipment and machinery to draw up work requests and job specifications . Design and oversee testing, installation, and repair of marine apparatus and equipment. Investigate and observe tests on machinery and equipment for compliance with standards. Ensures that assigned vessels are operating as safely as possible; works with crew to get vessel ready for annual regulatory inspections. Conduct environmental, operational or performance tests on marine machinery and equipment. Prepare technical reports for use by engineering, management, or sales personnel. Evaluate operation of marine equipment during acceptance testing and sea trials. Review work requests and compare them with previous work completed on ships to ensure that costs are economically sound. Analyzes problems and interfaces with appropriate operations personnel. Perform monitoring activities to ensure that ships comply with international regulations and standards for life saving equipment and pollution preventatives. Maintain and coordinate repair of machinery and equipment on vessels. Maintain records of engineering department activities, including cost tracking and details of equipment maintenance and repairs. Schedule machine overhauls and the servicing of electrical, heating, ventilation, refrigeration, water, and sewage systems. Qualifications REQUIRED Three (3) Years minimum related experience with the knowledge of vessel marine operations; including maintenance, regulatory compliance, administration, and customer service. PREFERRED High School diploma or General Education Degree (GED) is required. Vocational training is preferred. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES, AND OTHER CHARACTERISTICS Knowledge of appropriate steps to analytical problem solving. Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships. Ability to work in a team environment, remaining attentive to ideas, recognizing responsibilities, and actively participating with others to accomplish assignments and achieve desired goals. Treats others fairly and with respect. Knowledge of department's policies, rules, regulations, business goals, vision, organizational structure, culture, philosophy, operating principles, and values, etc. Ability to establish and maintain project priorities. Seeks out new learning experiences. Identifies what needs to be done and acts before being asked or required. Equal Opportunity Employer All qualified candidates will receive consideration for all positions without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or other non-merit factors.

title: Research Scientist
description: Position Title : Artificial Intelligence Research Scientist Department : 9030|IRI-Tech Transfer Responsibilities : Under the guidance of the Executive Director of the Informatics Research Institute, the Artificial Intelligence Research Scientist is a highly skilled researcher who will play a critical role in advancing the field of Artificial Intelligence research within the Informatics Research Institute. The preferred focus areas are natural language processing, computer vision, or machine learning, but other areas will be considered in the case of an exceptionally strong candidate. Responsibilities: Lead and manage research projects on artificial intelligence. Conduct research in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and develop AI systems for applications. Develop and implement research proposals. Analyze and interpret research data. Collaborate with other scientists and engineers. Present research findings to stakeholders. Write and publish research papers and reports. Stay current on the latest research in the area. Additional projects and duties as assigned. Qualifications: Required Qualifications: Master’s degree in computer science or a related field. Preferred Qualifications: Ph.D. degree in computer science or a related field. Experience working with large data sets. Experience in natural language processing and large language model systems. Strong research and implementation skills in one or more sub-fields of artificial intelligence, as evidenced by publications or research products. Strong programming skills in AI method implementation and in system prototyping. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to explain methods and findings to stakeholders. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. The ideal candidate will have excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment. Job Ad# (req2693)

title: Engineer
description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team. KPMG is currently seeking a AI Technology Engineering, Prompt Engineer to join our National Audit Technology organization. Responsibilities: Drive the development and evolution of an LLM agent framework for orchestrating AI-agent based solutions; design and develop effective prompts and prompt strategies for the solutions leveraging knowledge of audit and generative AI technology; Drive the development and implementation of innovative generative AI solutions to enhance audit efficiency, improve data analysis, and risk assessment; ensure that solutions deliver tangible business value Ensure alignment between product strategy and implementation, working closely with Product Owners, Portfolio Managers, and Architects to deliver tangible business value; collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements, explore emerging AI capabilities Maintain detailed documentation of solutions, development processes, and solution performance metrics, while also developing business requirements aligned with the product roadmap and strategy Design and implement approaches for model benchmarking, fine tuning and ongoing monitoring; evaluate results and identify opportunities to improve results through fine tuning or further prompt optimization; analyze and interpret data to inform model performance and areas for further optimization Monitor the usage and impact of AI solutions in the audit process, gather user feedback for future research efforts, and stay updated on current and emerging trends in generative AI Qualifications: Minimum five years of experience developing solutions using AI, NLP and machine learning technologies; or experience as a senior associate (or higher) in external audit, internal audit or similar professional services; 1-2 years of experience building solutions with generative AI technologies Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, AI, Data Science or related field is preferred; Or a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in accounting with a master’s in analytics or related field Strong programming skills in Python and experience implementing AI and maching learning libraries (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch); Experience with generative AI technologies, including Lang Chain (or similar tools), vector databases, open source models Strong understanding of AI principles and how they can be applied to solve business problems Strong quantitative and analytical writing and communication skills coupled with strong critical thinking skills with ability to execute on the details; excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex technical information to non-technical audiences Capacity to work independently and as part of a team with the ability to communicate across various levels (200TEC) KPMG complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. If required, the ranges displayed below or via the URL below are specifically for those potential hires who will work in the location(s) listed. Any offered salary is determined based on relevant factors such as applicant's skills, job responsibilities, prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications and market considerations. In addition, the firm is proud to offer a comprehensive, competitive benefits package, with options designed to help you make the best decisions for yourself, your family, and your lifestyle. Available benefits are based on eligibility. Our Total Rewards package includes a variety of medical and dental plans, vision coverage, disability and life insurance, 401(k) plans, and a robust suite of personal well-being benefits to support your mental health. Depending on job classification, standard work hours, and years of service, KPMG provides Personal Time Off per fiscal year. Additionally, each year the firm publishes a calendar of holidays to be observed during the year and provides two firmwide breaks each year where employees will not be required to use Personal Time Off; one is at year end and the other is around the July 4th holiday. Additional details about our benefits can be found towards the bottom of our KPMG US Careers site at “Benefits & How We Work”. Honolulu Salary Range: Low: $82200 - High: $146300 Follow this link to obtain salary ranges by city outside of CA: https://www.kpmg.us/work-for-kpmg/pay-transparency.html/?id=6718-9 KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please. KPMG recruits on a rolling basis. Candidates are considered as they apply, until the opportunity is filled. Candidates are encouraged to apply expeditiously to any role(s) for which they are qualified that is also of interest to them. KPMG does not currently require partners or employees to be fully vaccinated or test negative for COVID-19 in order to go to KPMG offices, client sites or KPMG events, except when mandated by federal, state or local law. In some circumstances, clients also may require proof of vaccination or testing (e.g., to go to the client site).

title: Lead Engineer
description: Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. KPMG is currently seeking a Lead Engineer (Manager) Sentinel Subject Matter Expert (SME) to join our Digital Nexus Technology organization. This is a remote work opportunity. Responsibilities: Lead the design and implementation of Microsoft Sentinel solutions to enhance the organization's security posture Collaborate with cybersecurity architects to integrate Sentinel into the overall security infrastructure Serve as the go-to expert on Microsoft Sentinel, staying abreast of the latest features, updates, and best practices Provide guidance to the security team on utilizing Sentinel effectively for threat detection, incident response, and security analytics Integrate Sentinel with other security tools and technologies to create a cohesive and comprehensive security architecture Deploy data pipeline in Azure environment using tools such as Cribl/Logstash to collect on-premises data sources Qualifications: Minimum five years of recent experience with data pipeline architecture and implementation with a focus on cybersecurity data; in-depth knowledge of Microsoft Sentinel and other relevant security technologies Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field is preferred; relevant certifications such as Microsoft Certified or Sentinel Administrator or similar are preferred Strong understanding of data pipeline architecture and implementation; data collection experience; OOTB (out of the box) data connectors, Linux configuration, Syslog/CEF (Common Event Format) Experience using Azure tools Notebooks, BYOML (Bring Your Own Machine Learning), or Open AI (Artificial Intelligence) is a big plus Familiar with Azure connected machine agent deployments using Azure Arc and creating custom rules and connections; proven experience utilizing Azure DevOps for managing several Azure Sentinel instances in multiple tenants Excellent leadership and communication skills US Citizenship is required KPMG complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team. KPMG is currently seeking a Lead Engineer (Manager) Sentinel Subject Matter Expert (SME) to join our Digital Nexus Technology organization. This is a remote work opportunity. Responsibilities: Lead the design and implementation of Microsoft Sentinel solutions to enhance the organization's security posture Collaborate with cybersecurity architects to integrate Sentinel into the overall security infrastructure Serve as the go-to expert on Microsoft Sentinel, staying abreast of the latest features, updates, and best practices Provide guidance to the security team on utilizing Sentinel effectively for threat detection, incident response, and security analytics Integrate Sentinel with other security tools and technologies to create a cohesive and comprehensive security architecture Deploy data pipeline in Azure environment using tools such as Cribl/Logstash to collect on-premises data sources Qualifications: Minimum five years of recent experience with data pipeline architecture and implementation with a focus on cybersecurity data; in-depth knowledge of Microsoft Sentinel and other relevant security technologies Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Information Security, or a related field is preferred; relevant certifications such as Microsoft Certified or Sentinel Administrator or similar are preferred Strong understanding of data pipeline architecture and implementation; data collection experience; OOTB (out of the box) data connectors, Linux configuration, Syslog/CEF (Common Event Format) Experience using Azure tools Notebooks, BYOML (Bring Your Own Machine Learning), or Open AI (Artificial Intelligence) is a big plus Familiar with Azure connected machine agent deployments using Azure Arc and creating custom rules and connections; proven experience utilizing Azure DevOps for managing several Azure Sentinel instances in multiple tenants Excellent leadership and communication skills US Citizenship is required KPMG complies with all local/state regulations regarding displaying salary ranges. If required, the ranges displayed below or via the URL below are specifically for those potential hires who will work in the location(s) listed. Any offered salary is determined based on relevant factors such as applicant's skills, job responsibilities, prior relevant experience, certain degrees and certifications and market considerations. In addition, the firm is proud to offer a comprehensive, competitive benefits package, with options designed to help you make the best decisions for yourself, your family, and your lifestyle. Available benefits are based on eligibility. Our Total Rewards package includes a variety of medical and dental plans, vision coverage, disability and life insurance, 401(k) plans, and a robust suite of personal well-being benefits to support your mental health. Depending on job classification, standard work hours, and years of service, KPMG provides Personal Time Off per fiscal year. Additionally, each year the firm publishes a calendar of holidays to be observed during the year and provides two firmwide breaks each year where employees will not be required to use Personal Time Off; one is at year end and the other is around the July 4th holiday. Additional details about our benefits can be found towards the bottom of our KPMG US Careers site at “Benefits & How We Work”. Follow this link to obtain salary ranges by city outside of CA: https://www.kpmg.us/work-for-kpmg/pay-transparency.html/?id=6701-9 KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship status, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please. KPMG recruits on a rolling basis. Candidates are considered as they apply, until the opportunity is filled. Candidates are encouraged to apply expeditiously to any role(s) for which they are qualified that is also of interest to them. KPMG does not currently require partners or employees to be fully vaccinated or test negative for COVID-19 in order to go to KPMG offices, client sites or KPMG events, except when mandated by federal, state or local law. In some circumstances, clients also may require proof of vaccination or testing (e.g., to go to the client site).

title: Automation Engineer
description: In this role at Iyrix , We are in search of an Automation Engineering Supervisor tasked with the application of advanced factory automation concepts and techniques to land-based recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS). This role, based in Baton Rouge, LA, involves overseeing the RAS Automation team, ensuring support for project engineers and designers in their endeavors to develop and implement designs, quality control, and testing of electrical panels for automating aquaculture production facilities. The Automation Engineering Supervisor will maintain communication with upper management regarding project statuses, schedule reviews, and risk mitigation plans. Additionally, the successful candidate will act as a liaison between the RAS design team and production. There may be occasions where the Automation Engineering Supervisor is required to attend select client meetings to provide support for automation design queries during the design review process. Responsibilities Serve in a leadership role, directly supervising and mentoring project engineers, and designers Help set project priorities and manage project workflow, ensuring design documents are provided to production in a timely manner, and products are QC’d and tested on time for customer delivery Participate in design review meetings and provide peer reviews of design drawings Ensure overall compliance to the engineering document control process Interface with Iyrix designers and engineers from multiple disciplines, manufacturing, field installation, customers and consultants Travel is required to client sites, including some International opportunities Required Skills and Experience Minimum of 3 years demonstrated supervisory experience in the engineering sector and leading a team Knowledge of PLC-based control systems Proven track record working with systems engineering functions including concept of operations development, requirements management, technical risk management, interface definition and control Familiarity with National Electrical Code requirements and able to ensure its application to all products developed by the team Experience effectively communicating and presenting with all levels of management and individual contributors on the program team Strong organization, coordination, planning and collaboration skills Experience supporting engineering teams in a multi-discipline environment Experience conducting system integration and system test to include development of integration and test plans, test cases and procedures Ability to visualize system functionality, to create block diagrams, and to analyze system performance Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Industrial control system related experience Experience configuring Human Machine Interface (HMI) graphics (especially Rockwell FactoryTalk View SE or Ignition) Experience in applying machine learning techniques and algorithms to data streams from PLC control systems, IOT and other data sources to monitor and control a facility’s operation, a plus Familiar with CAD drafting software Knowledge of and proficiency with Ethernet networks and devices, Modbus TCP and RTU, and common communications protocols (SPI, I2C, CAN, USB, RS-232) Integration of IOT into the control systems as feedback loops where appropriate Understanding of object-oriented programming languages (especially Python, Java, or C# a plus). Experience with developing the architecture and user interface and functionality for facility level management of multiple disparate subsystems Education B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Control Systems or Systems Engineering. Benefits of the Job Competitive salary commensurate with experience Comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability Paid time off and holidays 401k with company match Opportunity for travel to sites within the US and international locations Opportunity to lead a small team within a growing organization providing continued professional and career development How to Apply If you want to be part of a global, diverse, passionate, and fun environment where you can really make a difference; please apply today! To apply please send your resume and cover letter to: info@iyrix.com or Apply on indeed. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $113,000.00 - $143,000.00 per year Experience level: 3 years Work setting: Remote Application Question(s): Do you have Minimum 3 years demonstrated supervisory experience in the engineering sector and leading a team? Do you have Knowledge of PLC-based control systems? Do you have Familiarity with National Electrical Code requirements? Do you have a B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Control Systems or Systems Engineering? Work Location: In person

title: Automation Engineer
description: Description: ReCon is seeking an Automation Engineer who will be responsible for applying advanced factory automation concepts and techniques to land-based recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS). The position is responsible for supervising the RAS Automation team in Baton Rouge, LA, ensuring project engineers and designers are supported in their efforts to develop and execute on designs, QC, and testing of electrical panels to automate aquaculture production facilities. This position requires at least three years of experience and a degree in Electrical, Control System or System Engineering. This position is a full-time, direct-hire role at a local industry leader in the Baton Rouge area. (*IN PLANT ROLE - See Client specific information below in Job Requirements) Summary of Description: Technical supervision of design and drafting. Design, implementation and enforcement of company standards and policies. Management of personnel. Duties: Prepare man hour budget and review forecast Prepare scope documents as necessary Prepare space, manpower & equipment required Select staff Prepare and evaluate schedule Direct work Attend/conduct meetings Assignment of tasks and employees Ensure technical compliance Implement standards, specifications, and procedures Quality review Training & interviewing of personnel Perform other job-related duties as assigned. Education and Experience: Bachelor of Science in Engineering from an accredited university with at least fifteen (15) years of experience, primarily in the refinery, petrochemical, or chemical industries, or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job such as those listed above. License Requirements: Valid Driver’s License as per State law or requirement Professional Engineer License desired Specific Skills: Seeking to mentor younger engineers. Proficient in Microsoft Office and Outlook or similar software. Experienced with discipline-specific computer applications (i.e., ETAP, STAAD, CAESAR, etc.). Communication – good oral and written skills are required. Knowledge of regulatory codes and requirements in the related discipline required. Knowledge related to design in discipline field expected. Knowledge of key aspects of Civil, Mechanical, I/E and Chemical Engineering Physical Requirements: Ability to walk up to one mile on industrial plant and construction sites outdoors at any time of the year. Ability to work in protective clothing which may elevate body temperatures by several degrees Fahrenheit for periods of up to 15 minutes without a break. Ability to use multi-level stair towers and rung ladders unassisted. Ability to hear safety alarms and signals while wearing hearing protection. Ability to sit at desk and operate computer for extended periods of time. Ability to stand, use hands and fingers, grip, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; and talk and hear. Ability to see with visual acuity and distinguish between colors. Ability to operate a motor vehicle and have a valid driver’s license. Ability to lift and carry 15 lbs. on a regular basis is required and at times lifting up to 25 lbs. may be required. Requirements: Due to in plant position the below referenced Job Duties have been provided by client: Role and Responsibilities Candidate in this position will: Potentially serve in a leadership role, supervising and mentoring project engineers and designers. Help set project priorities and manage project workflow, ensuring design documents are provided to production in a timely manner, and products are QC’d and tested on time for customer delivery. Participate in design review meetings and provide peer reviews of design drawings. Ensure overall compliance to the engineering document control process. Interface with designers and engineers from multiple disciplines, manufacturing, field installation, customers and consultants Travel is required to client sites, including some International opportunities. Required Experience and Skills Minimum of 3 years demonstrated supervisory experience in the engineering sector. Knowledge of PLC-based control systems is required. Proven track record working with systems engineering functions including concept of operations development, requirements management, technical risk management, interface definition and control. Familiarity with National Electrical Code requirements and able to ensure its application to all products developed by the team. Experience in applying machine learning techniques and algorithms to data streams from PLC control systems, IOT and other data sources to monitor and control a facility’s operation, a plus. Experience effectively communicating and presenting with all levels of management and individual contributors on the program team. Strong organization, coordination, planning and collaboration skills. Experience supporting engineering teams in a multi-discipline environment. Experience conducting system integration and system test to include development of integration and test plans, test cases and procedures. Ability to visualize system functionality, to create block diagrams, and to analyze system performance. Education B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Control Systems or Systems Engineering. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Industrial control system related experience. Experience configuring Human Machine Interface (HMI) graphics (especially Rockwell FactoryTalk View SE or Ignition). Familiar with CAD drafting software. Knowledge of and proficiency with Ethernet networks and devices, Modbus TCP and RTU, and common communications protocols (SPI, I2C, CAN, USB, RS-232). Integration of IOT into the control systems as feedback loops where appropriate. Understanding of object-oriented programming languages (especially Python, Java, or C# a plus).

title: Automation Engineer
description: Automation Engineering Supervisor | Baton Rouge, LA INNOVASEA | Aquatic Solutions Built for Life Innovasea is revolutionizing aquaculture by combining technological know-how with hands-on industry expertise to deliver innovative, end-to-end solutions that maximize grow-out from egg to harvest – whether on land or in the open ocean. While our systems are precision engineered around each customer’s unique siting, production and monitoring needs – and built to withstand the harshest environments – the outcomes of our work are uniform: Optimized species health. Scaled-up operations. Stable equipment costs. And a partner who’s invested in seeing the customer succeed. Today. Tomorrow. For life. Role and Responsibilities We are seeking an Automation Engineering Supervisor who will be responsible for applying advanced factory automation concepts and techniques to land-based recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS). The position is responsible for supervising the RAS Automation team in Baton Rouge, LA, ensuring project engineers and designers are supported in their efforts to develop and execute on designs, QC, and testing of electrical panels to automate aquaculture production facilities. The Automation Engineering Supervisor will communicate with upper management on the status of projects, review of schedules and risk mitigation plans. In this capacity, the successful applicant will also provide a link to the RAS design team and production. The Automation Engineering Supervisor may be required to attend select client meetings to ensure automation design questions are supported in the design review process. Candidate in this position will: Serve in a leadership role, directly supervising and mentoring project engineers, and designers Help set project priorities and manage project workflow, ensuring design documents are provided to production in a timely manner, and products are QC’d and tested on time for customer delivery Participate in design review meetings and provide peer reviews of design drawings Ensure overall compliance to the engineering document control process Interface with Innovasea designers and engineers from multiple disciplines, manufacturing, field installation, customers and consultants Travel is required to client sites, including some International opportunities Required Skills and Experience Minimum of 3 years demonstrated supervisory experience in the engineering sector and leading a team Knowledge of PLC-based control systems Proven track record working with systems engineering functions including concept of operations development, requirements management, technical risk management, interface definition and control Familiarity with National Electrical Code requirements and able to ensure its application to all products developed by the team Experience effectively communicating and presenting with all levels of management and individual contributors on the program team Strong organization, coordination, planning and collaboration skills Experience supporting engineering teams in a multi-discipline environment Experience conducting system integration and system test to include development of integration and test plans, test cases and procedures Ability to visualize system functionality, to create block diagrams, and to analyze system performance Education B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Control Systems or Systems Engineering. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Industrial control system related experience Experience configuring Human Machine Interface (HMI) graphics (especially Rockwell FactoryTalk View SE or Ignition) Experience in applying machine learning techniques and algorithms to data streams from PLC control systems, IOT and other data sources to monitor and control a facility’s operation, a plus Familiar with CAD drafting software Knowledge of and proficiency with Ethernet networks and devices, Modbus TCP and RTU, and common communications protocols (SPI, I2C, CAN, USB, RS-232) Integration of IOT into the control systems as feedback loops where appropriate Understanding of object-oriented programming languages (especially Python, Java, or C# a plus). Experience with developing the architecture and user interface and functionality for facility level management of multiple disparate subsystems Benefits of the Job Competitive salary commensurate with experience Comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability Paid time off and holidays 401k with company match Opportunity for travel to sites within the US and international locations Opportunity to lead a small team within a growing organization providing continued professional and career development About Innovasea Fueled by leading-edge technology and a passion for research and development, Innovasea is revolutionizing aquaculture and advancing the science of fish tracking to make our oceans and freshwater ecosystems sustainable for future generations. With 275 employees worldwide, we provide full end-to-end solutions for fish farming and aquatic species research – including quality equipment that’s efficient and built to last, expert consulting services, and innovative platforms and products that deliver unrivaled data, information, and insights. How to Apply If you want to be part of a global, diverse, passionate, and fun environment where you can really make a difference; please apply today! To apply please send your resume and cover letter to: jobs@innovasea.com No phone calls, no unsolicited third-party recruiters, or agencies, please. Innovasea is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

title: Data Scientist
description: Job Description This position is for a Data Scientist at the in Shreveport, LA and is responsible for supporting our project teams with insights gained from analyzing associated data. Utilize large data sets to find opportunities for process optimization and build models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Use a variety of data mining/data analysis methods and data tools; build and implement models; use/create algorithms; and create/run simulations. Ability to drive project success with their data-based insights. Will work with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. Duties and Responsibilities: Work with stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging internal and external data to drive business solutions. Mine and analyze data from multiple data sources to drive optimization and improvement of system development, future strategies, marketing techniques and business strategies. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Use A.I., machine learning, and predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, trade-off analysis, and other business outcomes. Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models, perform analysis, and monitor outcomes. Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data validation and accuracy. Work with data engineers and analysts to curate varying data sources and create and maintain data repositories. Maintain effective internal and external customer relations. Effectively visualize and communicate results and findings in an actionable manner. Recommend actions or decisions to improve data processes, data utility, and results. Perform special projects as requested. Requirements and Qualifications: Eligible for SCI-DCID 6/4 Top Secret Clearance. US citizenship required. Bachelor's degree (minimum) in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another relevant quantitative field. Experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models. Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc. Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages such as R, Python, SQL, etc. Experience using web services such as Redshift, S3, Spark, Digital Ocean, etc. Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc. Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers such as Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc. Experience with distributed data/computing tools such as MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc. Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using such as Periscope, Business Objects, D3, etc. Experience working with and creating data architectures. Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on process optimization. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams and communicating findings. Proficiency with Microsoft Office products and like programs. Work Requirements Hours: 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Mon-Fri (typical). Due to the nature of the business and depending on specific event schedules, the employee may be required to vary typical work hours. Occasional weekend work could be required. Occasional travel may be required. Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: 3d Graphics Developer
description: Moffatt & Nichol specializes in large complex waterfront infrastructure projects and is recognized as one of the worldwide leaders in this field. We are actively looking for a 3D Graphics Engineer to join any of our US offices to support our FlexTerm group. FlexTerm is a real-time 3D industrial simulation platform where complex logistics systems are studied, designed, optimized, developed, and tested before being deployed into production. It allows to model any kind of system; however, it is mostly applied to highly automated facilities such as ports, container terminals, automated warehouses and factories, etc. These systems typically integrate infrastructure, equipment, people, automatic control systems, sensors, complex business logic, artificial intelligence, and machine learning to perform a common goal. As a Software Engineer, you will work closely with highly talented and experienced engineers to achieve the vision of FlexTerm in becoming the ultimate tool for planning, designing, and testing complex automated systems. About Moffatt & Nichol Moffatt & Nichol is a leading U.S.-based global infrastructure advisor specializing in the planning and design of facilities that shape and serve our coastlines, harbors and rivers, as well as an innovator in the transportation complexities associated with the movement of freight. For the 2 nd year in a row, Moffatt & Nichol is ranked Engineering News Record #1 for Marine & Port Facilities and Top 20 in Transportation. We were also named Southeast Design Firm of the Year 2023 Moffatt & Nichol's professional staff includes engineers, planners, and scientists who serve our global client base from offices in Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Pacific Rim. The firm provides clients worldwide with customized service and a level of excellence that have become the firm’s hallmark in several primary practice areas – ports and harbors; coastal, environmental and water resources; urban waterfronts and marinas; transportation, bridges and rail; inspection and rehabilitation; and energy. Duties and responsibilities: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions. Craft highly effective C++ code to develop and maintain the applications in the FlexTerm platform. Write unit and integration tests for new and existing functionality. Contribute to the overall platform vision, architecture, and design. Excel with agile development methodologies. Write technical documentation and user manuals in the team’s wiki site in Confluence. Other duties: Please note this job posting is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Qualifications: M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Computer Science or related discipline (Systems/Industrial Engineering, Electrical/Electronics/Computer Engineering, Mechatronics or Mechanical Engineering with emphasis in Robotics). Proven software development experience Minimum 3 years of experience as a software engineer. Proven education or experience in: Computer programming Data structures and algorithms Compilers Operating systems Database systems Networks and distributed systems Numerical methods 3D computer graphics and animation Lineal algebra and vector calculus Physics (Mechanics) Statistics and probability Operations research (mathematical programming/optimization) Discrete-event system simulation Desired experience in: Real-time metrics/BI systems AI/ML development Fluent in a C-like programming language such as C, C++, C#, Objective-C, Swift, Lua, Java, Javascript. Desired skills: Low level 3D/VR libraries such as OpenGL, GLSL, Vulkan. GUI frameworks such as Qt/ImGUI. Database systems such as Influx, Elastic, SQLServer and PostgreSQL DB, etc. Developing for multiple operating systems and devices: Windows, MacOS, Linux, iOS, Android. Developing and architecting end to end web services and applications. AI/ML frameworks such as Torch, TensorFlow, OpenCV. OS scripting languages such as MS-DOS batch, Sh and Powershell. Working with multiple exchange formats like XML, JSON, Protobuf. Working with version control systems such as Git, Gitlab and SourceTree. Working with cloud systems such as Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure. Automate software deployment to users (DevOps). Test-driven development processes and tools. All new hires will be required to successfully complete and pass a pre-employment (post offer) background check in compliance with NIST 800-171 Moffatt & Nichol uses E-Verify and employment is contingent upon the legal ability to obtain employment in the U.S. and to present the required documentation at hire Moffatt & Nichol EEO Statement As a global business, Moffatt & Nichol relies on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goal of Creative People, Practical Solutions® serving our client needs, and ensures nondiscrimination in all activities in accordance with Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964. We continuously seek talented, qualified employees in our world-wide operations regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, religion, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Moffatt & Nichol is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer/ Federal Contractor desiring priority referrals of all protected veterans for job openings. EEO is the LAW If you need more information or require special assistance for persons with disabilities or limited English proficiency, please contact Human Resources at (562) 590-6500 or TTY/TDD users please call 711.

Database systems such as Influx, Elastic, SQLServer and Oracle DB, DB2, etc. Developing for multiple operating systems and devices: Windows, MacOS, Linux, iOS, Android. title: Software Engineer
description: Moffatt & Nichol specializes in large complex waterfront infrastructure projects and is recognized as one of the worldwide leaders in this field. We are actively looking for a Backend and DevOps engineer to join our any of our US offices to support our FlexTerm group. FlexTerm is a real-time 3D industrial simulation platform where complex logistics systems are studied, designed, optimized, developed, and tested before being deployed into production. It allows to model any kind of system; however, it is mostly applied to highly automated facilities such as ports, container terminals, automated warehouses and factories, etc. These systems typically integrate infrastructure, equipment, people, automatic control systems, sensors, complex business logic, artificial intelligence, and machine learning to perform a common goal. As a Software Engineer, you will work closely with highly talented and experienced engineers to achieve the vision of FlexTerm in becoming the ultimate tool for planning, designing, and testing complex automated systems. About Moffatt & Nichol Moffatt & Nichol is a leading U.S.-based global infrastructure advisor specializing in the planning and design of facilities that shape and serve our coastlines, harbors and rivers, as well as an innovator in the transportation complexities associated with the movement of freight. For the 2 nd year in a row, Moffatt & Nichol is ranked Engineering News Record #1 for Marine & Port Facilities and Top 20 in Transportation. We were also named Southeast Design Firm of the Year 2023. Moffatt & Nichol's professional staff includes engineers, planners, and scientists who serve our global client base from offices in Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Pacific Rim. The firm provides clients worldwide with customized service and a level of excellence that have become the firm’s hallmark in several primary practice areas – ports and harbors; coastal, environmental and water resources; urban waterfronts and marinas; transportation, bridges and rail; inspection and rehabilitation; and energy. Duties and responsibilities: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions. Craft highly effective Javascript/Typescript/C++ code to develop and maintain the cloud backend of the FlexTerm platform Write unit and integration tests for new and existing functionality Contribute to the overall platform vision, architecture, and design Excel with agile development methodologies Write technical documentation and user manuals in the team’s wiki site in Confluence Other duties: Please note this job posting is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Qualifications: M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Computer Science or related discipline (Systems/Industrial Engineering, Electrical/Electronics/Computer Engineering, Mechatronics or Mechanical Engineering with emphasis in Robotics). Minimum 3 years of experience as a software engineer Proven software development experience Proven education or experience in: Computer programming Data Structures and algorithms Compilers Operating systems Database systems Networks and Distributed Systems Computer Graphics Lineal Algebra Physics (Mechanics) Statistics and Probability Operations Research (mathematical programming/optimization) Desired experience in: Discrete-event system simulation 3D computer graphics and animation Real-time metrics/BI systems Fluent in a C-like programming language such as C, C++, C#, Objective-C, Swift, Lua, Java, Javascript/Typescript. Desired skills: Low level 3D/VR libraries such as OpenGL, GLSL, Vulkan. GUI frameworks such as Qt/ImGUI. Database systems such as Influx, Elastic, SQLServer and Oracle DB, DB2, etc. Developing for multiple operating systems and devices: Windows, MacOS, Linux, iOS, Android. Developing end-to-end web services and applications (using SOAP, REST APIs). Firsthand experience with front end web technologies such as: HTML5, DHTML, Stylesheets (CSS), JavaScript, Ajax, React and jQuery. OS scripting languages such as MS-DOS batch, Sh and Powershell. Working with multiple exchange formats like XML, JSON, Protobuf. Working with version control systems such as Git, Gitlab and SourceTree. Working with cloud systems such as Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure. Automate software deployment to users using CI/CD pipelines (DevOps).
