title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Job Location Pineville Job Description The Opportunity As a Data Science/Machine Learning Engineer you will be the driving force behind everything we do at P&G. Across the world, you will find thousands of scientists, engineers and developers working in manufacturing plants, innovation centers and distribution facilities. You will be a key member of the engineering team driving end-to-end data and analytical solutions supporting the development, learning, and operational insights for our critical new engineering led initiatives in equipment, process, packaging, customization and supply chain. You will apply Data Science and Analytics techniques to support our Fabric and Home Care business and fuel our value creation pipeline by: You will be in the ideal place to work on groundbreaking improvements at our manufacturing sites to apply Data Science and analytics technologies to support our Fabric and Home Care Business and fuel our value creation via digital solutions. Our aim is to ignite your potential and equip you to enhance the capability, safety, security, and productivity of all our systems while reducing cost and boosting sustainability. What we offer! Wide range of challenging engineering assignments in one of the most influential companies in the world; Development and delivery of cutting edge technologies supported by multi-million capital investments; Leadership onboarding program including 6-12 months placement in different functions of our supply chain enabling you to see the business and each functions‘ unique data ; Extensive and structured training process supported by a dedicated coach. Mentorship program to accelerate your growth and reach your potential; Informal and friendly international work environment of an offshore engineering office delivering technical projects across the world; International travel to the project locations to see your design come to life; Very competitive compensation and benefits including pay for performance and flexible work arrangement. Job Responsibilities Partnering with our global teams to identify needs to help our production floor, facilitate our work processes, or improve our Business in generalDevelop analysis of equipment and work processes with relevant data sources by identification and implementation of performance indicators Guiding and supporting implementation of systematic use of advanced analytics in Product Supply organization, in collaboration with domain expert and information systems specialists Engage project teams to understand project needs/requirements and provide technical expertise with data and analytical tools. Design digital solutions that facilitate the access to information contained in the data by providing access, pertinent analysis, appropriate visualization techniques as well as the workflow to support efficient decision making in production environment Collaborate with data leaders and multi-discipline teams to design, develop and ensure critical data systems infrastructures and integration offer critical data model availability and scalability. Design of digital solutions to be embedded into our production control strategies Support roll-out of successful solutions by defining scale-up approach and global deployment strategy Data Model definition and documentation for deployable solutions Explore emerging capabilities and Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning for flawless integration and application between data scientist, functional specialists and their key user cases.. Your first assignment gives you the chance to set technical direction by applying and building mastery in our Product Supply Engineering innovation and delivery efforts, while demonstrating diverse data, analytics and visualization skills. You have clear responsibilities that stretch your technical abilities. You will work in professional and entrepreneurial cross-functional teams while receiving valuable mentoring as well as functional and corporate trainings. Job Qualifications Required Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field Strong background in statistics, mathematics, and computer science, with a focus on machine learning and data science. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, and experience with relevant libraries and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn). Solid understanding of machine learning techniques, such as regression, classification, clustering, natural language processing, deep learning, and reinforcement learning. Experience with data manipulation and analysis using SQL and/or NoSQL databases. Ability to preprocess and clean data, handle missing values, and perform feature engineering. Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Matplotlib, Seaborn, Tableau) to effectively communicate insights. Knowledge of cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and experience with distributed computing frameworks (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to develop innovative solutions to complex business challenges. Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and understandable manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Strong attention to detail, with the ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Preferred University Master degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Data Engineering or similar with good academic results and a maximum of 3 years previous work experience All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, marital status, citizenship, HIV/AIDS status or any other legally protected factor. Immigration sponsorship is not available for this role. As a general matter, Procter & Gamble does not sponsor candidates for nonimmigrant visas or permanent residency. However, Procter & Gamble may make exceptions on a discretionary basis. Any exceptions would be based on the Company's specific business needs at the time and place of recruitment as well as the particular qualifications of the individual. Procter & Gamble participates in e-verify as required by law. Qualified individuals will not be disadvantaged based on being unemployed. Job Schedule Full time Job Number R000093879 Job Segmentation Experienced Professionals (Job Segmentation) Starting Pay / Salary Range $146,000.00 - $172,000.00 / year

title: Vdi Engineer
description: Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) Engineer Employment Type: Full-Time, Experienced Department: Virtual Machine Infrastructure As a CGS Virtual Desktop Infrastructure Engineer, you will be involved with developing, testing, and implementing virtualized workstation images as well as virtualized applications using VMware ThinApp. CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve government’s most dynamic problems with cutting edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates that are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities. Skills and attributes for success: Develop, test, and implement virtualized workstation images as well as virtualized applications using VMware ThinApp. Perform Tier 3-level incident and problem support of virtualized images as well as providing any necessary recommendations on potential image/system enhancements, speed, security, etc. Qualifications: Extensive experience in developing virtualized workstation images in large enterprise environments, to specifically include tailoring those workstation images for virtual desktops. Capabilities in creating virtualized applications using VMware ThinApp both a lab and large scale (5,000+ user base) production enterprise environment. Significant experience (4+ years) using VMware ThinApp, VMware Horizon View, and VMware vSphere products. Experience in capturing requirements, documenting detailed system designs and related system test cases, executing system tests, documenting implementation plans, operations guides, and disaster recovery content. “Hands-on” system engineering experience and competency in: VMware Horizon View, VMware ThinApp, MS Windows 10 integration, PowerShell, or related scripting. Mature, self-starting individual seeking an opportunity of minimal supervisory guidance. Ability to acquire an EOUSA Public Trust-Level 6 EOD Waiver as a result of an SF85P+PS investigation). Ideally, you will also have: Understanding of Cisco UCS platforms. Related VMware certifications such as VCA, VCP, VCAP, or VCDX. MS Windows 10 integration. SCCM application deployment/patching. Interacting with Government clients on a regular basis. Working understanding of project management best practices. Large, enterprise-scale integration. ITIL certification. Adjudicated and active Public Trust Level 6 or Top Secret clearance. Our commitment: Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our clients’ specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems. For the past seven years we’ve been growing our government-contracting portfolio, and along the way we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work. Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come. We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Health, Dental, and Vision Life Insurance 401k Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter) Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal Holidays Join our team and become part of meaningful government innovation! Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board: https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/ For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact: Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: Environmental Engineer
description: What if you were given the opportunity and responsibility to make a difference? At International Paper, you control your destiny. We offer challenging assignments and total rewards in countries around the world. When we say infinite possibilities, we mean it. Apply now and join a community that improves people’s lives, the planet and our company’s performance by transforming renewable resources into products people depend on every day. Position Title: Environmental Engineer Pay Rate : $73,200 - $97,600 Multiple factors, including Individual experience, skills and abilities will determine where an employee is ultimately placed in the pay range. Category/Shift : Salaried Full-Time Physical Location : 1202 Highway 509 Mansfield LA 71052 The Job You Will Perform: The Mansfield Mill is a complex, fully integrated pulp and paper manufacturing facility. The mill includes multiple process lines of wood handling, pulping, paper machines, power and recovery boilers, and effluent treatment. The environmental engineer assists with managing day-to-day and some long-term activities for the mill’s Wastewater Treatment Plant (WWTP), air compliance program, solid and hazardous waste programs, potable water system, chemicals in transportation program, and landfill operation. The position has responsibility for supervising various contractors, works within the EHS&S group and reports to the Environmental Manager. Key Responsibilities: The Environmental Engineer’s duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, working with the Environmental Team to: Provide regulatory guidance to mill operations, maintenance, and management on a day-to-day or as needed basis. Drive continuous and deliberate improvements including systems development to ensure environmental compliance and prevent problems Ensure completion of required compliance reports for waste water, solid waste, air potable water and chemical management Support operating teams navigating regulatory concerns, provide necessary compliance training to salaried and hourly teams Implement systems and processes to improve/sustain results for mill EMS systems. Serves as liaison between the organization on and regulatory agencies concerned with environmental control. Serve on Environmental, Health & Safety weekend rotation team. The Skills You Will Bring: A successful candidate has: Strong leadership skills that values inclusion and engagement Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate to groups and individuals at all levels, including external stakeholders. Analyze problems and develop solutions independently or with teams. Utilize strong organizational skills to handle multiple tasks effectively. Maintain process knowledge and understanding of Environmental systems and regulatory requirements. Required Experience: Two plus years of environmental management or related experience in a manufacturing environment recommended, pulp and paper industry preferred. Experience in practical application of environmental regulations required. This position requires a Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Environmental sciences, or related field. The candidate must be experienced using a computer, and skilled in word processing, database systems, and SAP business systems. Plant application and PI ProcessBook experience preferred. Experience as an FLL or managing direct reports preferred. Position Requirements: Action Oriented Timely Decision Making Decision Quality Organizing Priority Setting Drive For Results Functional/Technical Skills Learning on the Fly Certifications (will be required to get upon hiring if do not already have) Louisiana Potable Water Operator License Louisiana Wastewater operator license DOT hazamat shipper certification ground and IATA EPA Smoke School Key Competencies: Action Oriented, Organizational Skills, Managing and Measuring Work, Priority Setting, Building Effective Teams, Conflict Management, Ethics and Values, Integrity and Trust, Motivating Others, Managing through Systems, Listening, Informing, Managerial Courage, Functional Technical Skill/Knowledge. Qualified candidates should also possess good oral and written communication skills. The Benefits You Will Enjoy: Paid time off including Vacation and Holidays Retirement, and 401k Matching Program Medical & Dental Education & Development (including Tuition Reimbursement) Life & Disability Insurance The Career You Will Build: Leadership training Promotional opportunities The Impact You Will Make: We continue to build a better future for people, the plant, and our company! IP has been a good steward of sustainable practices across communities around the world for more than 120 years. Join our team and you’ll see why our team members say they’re Proud to be IP . The Culture You Will Experience: International Paper promotes employee well-being by providing safe, caring and inclusive workplaces. You will learn Safety Leadership Principles and have the opportunity to opt into Employee Networking Circles such as IPVets, IPride, Women in IP, and the African American ENC. We invite you to bring your uniqueness, creativity, talents, experiences, and safety mindset to be a part of our increasingly diverse culture. The Company You Will Join: International Paper (NYSE: IP) is a leading global supplier of renewable fiber-based products. We produce corrugated packaging products that protect and promote goods, and enable worldwide commerce, and pulp for diapers, tissue and other personal care products that promote health and wellness. Headquartered in Memphis, Tenn., we employ approximately 38,000 colleagues globally. We serve customers worldwide, with manufacturing operations in North America, Latin America, North Africa and Europe. International Paper is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. International Paper complies with federal and state disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact reasonable.accommodations@ipaper.com or (877) 973-3919. Mansfield LA 71052

title: Technical Lead
description: Technical Lead - Conversational AI Position Description CGI is seeking a Technical Lead for Conversational AI. You will be responsible for designing and implementing the architecture and infrastructure of conversational AI systems, which are used in applications such as chatbots, virtual assistants, and automated customer support systems. You will lead a team of data scientists & machine Learning engineers, shaping the direction of conversational AI projects, and ensuring the delivery of exceptional user experiences. The Technical Lead for Conversational AI will play a pivotal role in driving the organization's AI initiatives and delivering enhanced user experiences through conversational AI solutions. If you are a visionary leader with a passion for AI and a proven track record of success in this field, we encourage you to apply and join our dynamic team. Candidates must be willing to work on Eastern time zone. This is fulltime position. Your future duties and responsibilities Design high-level architecture of conversational AI systems, including the integration of various components like natural language understanding (NLU), natural language generation (NLG), dialogue management, and data storage. Lead and mentor a team of conversational AI engineers and data scientists, fostering collaboration and professional growth. Choose appropriate algorithms and machine learning models for tasks such as intent recognition, entity extraction, and sentiment analysis. Evaluate and select appropriate AI platforms, Open-Source tools, and frameworks for Product Development. Integrate and fine-tune pre-trained language models (e.g., GPT, BERT) to suit specific conversational applications. Develop strategies for data collection, storage, and preprocessing, as well as methods for managing user interactions and feedback. Create and manage the conversational flow, ensuring smooth interactions between the AI system and users. Ensure the conversational AI system can function across various communication channels (e.g., web chat, mobile apps, voice assistants). Design systems that can handle high volumes of concurrent users and accommodate future growth. Continuously improve the performance and efficiency of the conversational AI system, minimizing response times and resource consumption. Ensure smooth integration with external data sources, APIs, and other enterprise systems to provide comprehensive responses and actions. Implement security measures to protect user data and maintain compliance with data privacy regulations. Develop testing strategies to validate the accuracy and effectiveness of the conversational AI system, including functional testing and user testing. Create comprehensive documentation for the system architecture, including setup, maintenance, and troubleshooting guides. Required qualifications to be successful in this role 10+ years of experience in AI, NLP, and conversational AI development, including hands-on experience with NLP libraries and tools. Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or others commonly used in AI development. Experience working with machine learning techniques and NLP algorithms. Ability to design and implement scalable, modular conversational AI systems. Chat bot: 2 + years of experience with chatbot development for business use cases. Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) for deploying and scaling AI systems. LLM: At least one implementation of Conversational AI using Large Language Models. CI/CD: Familiarity with DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines. Effective communication is crucial for collaborating with cross-functional teams and explaining technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. The ability to tackle complex issues and adapt to rapidly evolving AI technologies. Understanding of data privacy regulations, security best practices, and ethical considerations in AI development. Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, artificial intelligence, or a related field. CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to: skill set level; experience and training; and licensure and certifications. CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $84,000 -$176,300. CGI anticipates accepting applications for this position through March 8, 2024. At CGI we call our professionals "members" to reinforce that all who join our team are, as owners, empowered to participate in the challenges and rewards that come from building a world-class company. CGI's benefits include: Competitive base salaries Eligibility to participate in an attractive Share Purchase Plan (SPP) in which the company matches dollar-for-dollar contributions made by eligible employees, up to a maximum, for their job category 401(k) Plan and Profit Participation for eligible members Generous holidays, vacation, and sick leave plans Comprehensive insurance plans that include, among other benefits, medical, dental, vision, life, disability, out-of-county emergency coverage in all countries of employment; Back-up child care, Pet insurance, a Member Assistance Program, a 529 college savings program, a personal financial management tool, lifestyle management programs and more. #LI-KB5 Insights you can act on While technology is at the heart of our clients' digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success. When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today - one of the world's largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services. At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist. Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI - where your ideas and actions make a difference. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, ancestry, color, sex, religion, creed, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, pregnancy, medical condition, military and veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or perceived sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, and gender expression, familial status, political affiliation, genetic information, height, weight, or any other legally protected status or characteristics. CGI provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation to apply for a job in the U.S., please email the CGI U.S. Employment Compliance mailbox at US_Employment_Compliance@cgi.com . You will need to reference the Position ID of the position in which you are interested. Your message will be routed to the appropriate recruiter who will assist you. Please note, this email address is only to be used for those individuals who need an accommodation to apply for a job. Emails for any other reason or those that do not include a Position ID will not be returned . We make it easy to translate military experience and skills! Click here to be directed to our site that is dedicated to veterans and transitioning service members. title: Post-doctoral Fellow
description: Thank you for your interest in The University of New Orleans. Once you start the application process, you will not be able to save your work, so you should collect all required information before you begin. The required information is listed below in the job posting. You must complete all required portions of the application and attached the required documents in order to be considered for employment. Department Computer Science Job Summary Job Description This research contract position will primarily focus on a new GulfSCEI project aimed at AI Automation to detect Flood Deficiencies in Flood Water Control Structures. Duties may include, but are not limited to: 60% - participate in the design, plan, coordination, and implementation of tasks in support of the project; 5% - supervise the research of undergraduate and/or graduate students; 10% - prepare reports for Federal agency and drafting of research papers for publication; 5% - participate in technical meeting with funding federal agency 5% - present papers at conferences; 5% - assist in developing research proposals to funding agencies; 10% - performs other duties as required. Required Qualifications: A Ph.D. Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or closely related field at is required by the date of hire. Expertise in Cloud Computing, Machine Learning, and AI is expected. Desired Qualifications: Expertise in Environmental Modeling and experience with DoD research and development activities, especially the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE. Salary: Salary Negotiable Appointment Period: The appointment period is for one-year (01/01/24-12/31/24). The position is renewable for up to 3 years based on availability of funds and satisfactory performance. Required Attachments Please upload the following documents in the Resume/Cover Letter section. Detailed resume listing relevant qualifications and experience; Cover Letter indicating why you are a good fit for the position and University of Louisiana Systems; Names and contact information of three references; Diversity Statement (required for all Faculty positions and any Staff position of Assistant Manager and higher). See Diversity Statement instructions by clicking this link: https://www.uno.edu/careers/diversity-instructions Applications that do not include the required uploaded documents may not be considered. Posting Close Date This position will remain open until filled. Note to Applicant: Applicants should fully describe their qualifications and experience with specific reference to each of the minimum and preferred qualifications in their cover letter. The search committee will use this information during the initial review of application materials. References will be contacted at the appropriate phase of the recruitment process. This position may require a criminal background check to be conducted on the candidate(s) selected for hire. As part of the hiring process, applicants for positions at the University of New Orleans may be required to demonstrate the ability to perform job-related tasks. The University of New Orleans is an Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected Veteran status, age if 40 or older, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Data Scientist
description: Data Scientist Posting Date: Jan 22, 2024 Location: Lake Charles, LA, US Houston, TX, US Company: Sasol A job at Sasol is a career made by you, with purpose, development opportunities, benefits to support every stage of life and a working culture that embraces flexibility, diversity, and inclusion. Learn more. Purpose of Job As a Data Scientist, you will be an integral part of one of our agile squads, working to realize value opportunities for our Operations colleagues through data analysis and application development. Your expertise in data analytics and solution implementation will enable your colleagues to generate insights from the available data to make our Operations more efficient and sustainable and to ensure they are well equipped for data-based decision-making. You will have the opportunity to access, integrate, prepare, and analyze large data sets, build analytics engines and services, and to design and prototype digital software solutions in close collaboration with stakeholders across our entire Operations organization. Key Accountabilities Proactively gather information from various data sources like SQL, Plant Operating Systems, ERP, and APIs provided by external service providers. Integrate and prepare large data sets of varying structure and complexity, architect data models, and design specialized database solutions. Visualize and analyze predominantly timeseries of production and business data with advanced statistical methods and state-of-the-art machine-learning techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive). Develop software solutions, both front- and backend, following best practices, to sustainably implement optimizations, algorithms, solutions, and predictions. Deploy advanced to complex models, algorithms, and tools for data gathering. Work in agile squads and collaborate closely with the Product Owner, Scrum Master, other developers, and stakeholders Actively participate in the Scrum process and meetings with the team and stakeholders, assist with communication, improve transparency, and radiate information. Apply your advanced knowledge and experience in applied statistics, optimization, and application of machine learning or deep learning techniques and make use of your solid programming skills in Python and SQL. Develop Apps and interactive dashboards and deploying models to production (Flask, Django, React, JavaScript or comparable, GIT, docker, Kubernetes, Azure) Formal Education University Bachelors Degree Working Experience Experience: 7+ relevant years Required Personal and Professional Skills Advanced knowledge and experience in applied statistics, optimization, and application of machine learning or deep learning techniques. Solid programming skills in Python and SQL. Know how in app and interactive dashboard development and deploying models to production (Flask, Django, React, JavaScript or comparable, GIT, docker, Kubernetes, Azure) Proven track record as a Data Scientist / Engineer / Full-stack Developer Fluent in written and verbal English Sasol is committed to promoting better, healthier lives for you and your family. Below is an overview of our benefits and compensation programs: • Flexible work schedules • Medical, including prescription drug benefits, Dental, and Vision (start day one of employment with no waiting period) • Retirement Pension Plan (company paid) • Savings and Investment plan (401k) with eligible company match • Paid vacation and holidays • Disability benefits • Paternal Leave • Fertility benefit or Family building • Other special programs, i.e., EAP (employee assistance program), wellness, pet benefits, caregiver support benefit, Aflac, Legal Guard, and many others • Comprehensive compensation program Sasol (USA) Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, disability or protected veteran status, as well as any other characteristic protected by applicable law, regulation or local ordinance. For more information about your rights under the law, see http://www.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/poster_screen_reader_optimized.pdf Sasol treats work-authorized job applicants equally in recruiting and hiring without regard to their citizenship status or national origin unless required by law, regulation, executive order, government contract, or determination by the Attorney General. Please note Sasol will not sponsor, obtain, and/or petition for temporary visa status (for example, E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J, or TN) for candidates for this position and/or personnel hired for this position. title: Research Scientist
description: Position Title : Cybersecurity Research Scientist (Cyber-Physical Systems) Department : 9030|IRI-Tech Transfer Responsibilities : The Cybersecurity Research Scientist is a skilled researcher who will play an essential role in advancing cybersecurity research within the Informatics Research Institute under the guidance of the Executive Director. The preferred focus area is cyber-physical system security, but other areas will be considered in the case of an exceptionally strong candidate. Responsibilities: Lead and manage research projects in cyber-physical system security. Conduct interdisciplinary research at the intersection of mechanical/material engineering, machine learning, and cybersecurity. The work will entail mathematical modeling, coding, conducting user studies, analyzing and interpreting research data, and publishing research outcomes. Develop and implement research proposals. Mentor graduate and undergraduate students. Collaborate with other scientists and engineers. Stay current on the latest research in the area. Additional projects and duties as assigned. Qualifications: Required Qualifications: Ph.D. degree in computer science or a related field. Strong research and implementation skills in one or more sub-fields of cyber-physical system security, as evidenced by publications or research products. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in two or more of these areas: machine learning, cybersecurity, mechanical engineering, material engineering. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to explain methods and findings to stakeholders. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. The ideal candidate will have excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment. Job Ad# (req2457)

Automation Engineer
description: In this role at Iyrix , We are in search of an Automation Engineering Supervisor tasked with the application of advanced factory automation concepts and techniques to land-based recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS). This role, based in Baton Rouge, LA, involves overseeing the RAS Automation team, ensuring support for project engineers and designers in their endeavors to develop and implement designs, quality control, and testing of electrical panels for automating aquaculture production facilities. The Automation Engineering Supervisor will maintain communication with upper management regarding project statuses, schedule reviews, and risk mitigation plans. Additionally, the successful candidate will act as a liaison between the RAS design team and production. There may be occasions where the Automation Engineering Supervisor is required to attend select client meetings to provide support for automation design queries during the design review process. Responsibilities Serve in a leadership role, directly supervising and mentoring project engineers, and designers Help set project priorities and manage project workflow, ensuring design documents are provided to production in a timely manner, and products are QC’d and tested on time for customer delivery Participate in design review meetings and provide peer reviews of design drawings Ensure overall compliance to the engineering document control process Interface with Iyrix designers and engineers from multiple disciplines, manufacturing, field installation, customers and consultants Travel is required to client sites, including some International opportunities Required Skills and Experience Minimum of 3 years demonstrated supervisory experience in the engineering sector and leading a team Knowledge of PLC-based control systems Proven track record working with systems engineering functions including concept of operations development, requirements management, technical risk management, interface definition and control Familiarity with National Electrical Code requirements and able to ensure its application to all products developed by the team Experience effectively communicating and presenting with all levels of management and individual contributors on the program team Strong organization, coordination, planning and collaboration skills Experience supporting engineering teams in a multi-discipline environment Experience conducting system integration and system test to include development of integration and test plans, test cases and procedures Ability to visualize system functionality, to create block diagrams, and to analyze system performance Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Industrial control system related experience Experience configuring Human Machine Interface (HMI) graphics (especially Rockwell FactoryTalk View SE or Ignition) Experience in applying machine learning techniques and algorithms to data streams from PLC control systems, IOT and other data sources to monitor and control a facility’s operation, a plus Familiar with CAD drafting software Knowledge of and proficiency with Ethernet networks and devices, Modbus TCP and RTU, and common communications protocols (SPI, I2C, CAN, USB, RS-232) Integration of IOT into the control systems as feedback loops where appropriate Understanding of object-oriented programming languages (especially Python, Java, or C# a plus). Experience with developing the architecture and user interface and functionality for facility level management of multiple disparate subsystems Education B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Control Systems or Systems Engineering. Benefits of the Job Competitive salary commensurate with experience Comprehensive benefits including medical, dental, vision, life and disability Paid time off and holidays 401k with company match Opportunity for travel to sites within the US and international locations Opportunity to lead a small team within a growing organization providing continued professional and career development How to Apply If you want to be part of a global, diverse, passionate, and fun environment where you can really make a difference; please apply today! To apply please send your resume and cover letter to: info@iyrix.com or Apply on indeed. Do you have Knowledge of PLC-based control systems? Do you have Familiarity with National Electrical Code requirements? Do you have a B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Control Systems or Systems Engineering? Work Location: In person

title: Automation Engineer
description: Description: ReCon is seeking an Automation Engineer who will be responsible for applying advanced factory automation concepts and techniques to land-based recirculating aquaculture systems (RAS). The position is responsible for supervising the RAS Automation team in Baton Rouge, LA, ensuring project engineers and designers are supported in their efforts to develop and execute on designs, QC, and testing of electrical panels to automate aquaculture production facilities. This position requires at least three years of experience and a degree in Electrical, Control System or System Engineering. This position is a full-time, direct-hire role at a local industry leader in the Baton Rouge area. (*IN PLANT ROLE - See Client specific information below in Job Requirements) Summary of Description: Technical supervision of design and drafting. Design, implementation and enforcement of company standards and policies. Management of personnel. Duties: Prepare man hour budget and review forecast Prepare scope documents as necessary Prepare space, manpower & equipment required Select staff Prepare and evaluate schedule Direct work Attend/conduct meetings Assignment of tasks and employees Ensure technical compliance Implement standards, specifications, and procedures Quality review Training & interviewing of personnel Perform other job-related duties as assigned. Education and Experience: Bachelor of Science in Engineering from an accredited university with at least fifteen (15) years of experience, primarily in the refinery, petrochemical, or chemical industries, or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to successfully perform the essential duties of the job such as those listed above. License Requirements: Valid Driver’s License as per State law or requirement Professional Engineer License desired Specific Skills: Seeking to mentor younger engineers. Proficient in Microsoft Office and Outlook or similar software. Experienced with discipline-specific computer applications (i.e., ETAP, STAAD, CAESAR, etc.). Communication – good oral and written skills are required. Knowledge of regulatory codes and requirements in the related discipline required. Knowledge related to design in discipline field expected. Knowledge of key aspects of Civil, Mechanical, I/E and Chemical Engineering Physical Requirements: Ability to walk up to one mile on industrial plant and construction sites outdoors at any time of the year. Ability to work in protective clothing which may elevate body temperatures by several degrees Fahrenheit for periods of up to 15 minutes without a break. Ability to use multi-level stair towers and rung ladders unassisted. Ability to hear safety alarms and signals while wearing hearing protection. Ability to sit at desk and operate computer for extended periods of time. Ability to stand, use hands and fingers, grip, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; and talk and hear. Ability to see with visual acuity and distinguish between colors. Ability to operate a motor vehicle and have a valid driver’s license. Ability to lift and carry 15 lbs. on a regular basis is required and at times lifting up to 25 lbs. may be required. Requirements: Due to in plant position the below referenced Job Duties have been provided by client: Role and Responsibilities Candidate in this position will: Potentially serve in a leadership role, supervising and mentoring project engineers and designers. Help set project priorities and manage project workflow, ensuring design documents are provided to production in a timely manner, and products are QC’d and tested on time for customer delivery. Participate in design review meetings and provide peer reviews of design drawings. Ensure overall compliance to the engineering document control process. Interface with designers and engineers from multiple disciplines, manufacturing, field installation, customers and consultants Travel is required to client sites, including some International opportunities. Required Experience and Skills Minimum of 3 years demonstrated supervisory experience in the engineering sector. Knowledge of PLC-based control systems is required. Proven track record working with systems engineering functions including concept of operations development, requirements management, technical risk management, interface definition and control. Familiarity with National Electrical Code requirements and able to ensure its application to all products developed by the team. Experience in applying machine learning techniques and algorithms to data streams from PLC control systems, IOT and other data sources to monitor and control a facility’s operation, a plus. Experience effectively communicating and presenting with all levels of management and individual contributors on the program team. Strong organization, coordination, planning and collaboration skills. Experience supporting engineering teams in a multi-discipline environment. Experience conducting system integration and system test to include development of integration and test plans, test cases and procedures. Ability to visualize system functionality, to create block diagrams, and to analyze system performance. Education B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Control Systems or Systems Engineering. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Industrial control system related experience. Experience configuring Human Machine Interface (HMI) graphics (especially Rockwell FactoryTalk View SE or Ignition). Familiar with CAD drafting software. Knowledge of and proficiency with Ethernet networks and devices, Modbus TCP and RTU, and common communications protocols (SPI, I2C, CAN, USB, RS-232). Integration of IOT into the control systems as feedback loops where appropriate. Understanding of object-oriented programming languages (especially Python, Java, or C# a plus).

title: Data Scientist
description: Job Description This position is for a Data Scientist at the in Shreveport, LA and is responsible for supporting our project teams with insights gained from analyzing associated data. Utilize large data sets to find opportunities for process optimization and build models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. Use a variety of data mining/data analysis methods and data tools; build and implement models; use/create algorithms; and create/run simulations. Ability to drive project success with their data-based insights. Will work with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. Duties and Responsibilities: Work with stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging internal and external data to drive business solutions. Mine and analyze data from multiple data sources to drive optimization and improvement of system development, future strategies, marketing techniques and business strategies. Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets. Use A.I., machine learning, and predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, trade-off analysis, and other business outcomes. Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models, perform analysis, and monitor outcomes. Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data validation and accuracy. Work with data engineers and analysts to curate varying data sources and create and maintain data repositories. Maintain effective internal and external customer relations. Effectively visualize and communicate results and findings in an actionable manner. Recommend actions or decisions to improve data processes, data utility, and results. Perform special projects as requested. Requirements and Qualifications: Eligible for SCI-DCID 6/4 Top Secret Clearance. US citizenship required. Bachelor's degree (minimum) in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another relevant quantitative field. Experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models. Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc. Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages such as R, Python, SQL, etc. Experience using web services such as Redshift, S3, Spark, Digital Ocean, etc. Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc. Experience analyzing data from 3rd party providers such as Google Analytics, Site Catalyst, Coremetrics, Adwords, Crimson Hexagon, Facebook Insights, etc. Experience with distributed data/computing tools such as MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc. Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using such as Periscope, Business Objects, D3, etc. Experience working with and creating data architectures. Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications. Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on process optimization. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams and communicating findings. Proficiency with Microsoft Office products and like programs. Work Requirements Hours: 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Mon-Fri (typical). Due to the nature of the business and depending on specific event schedules, the employee may be required to vary typical work hours. Occasional weekend work could be required. Occasional travel may be required. Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: 3d Graphics Developer
description: Moffatt & Nichol specializes in large complex waterfront infrastructure projects and is recognized as one of the worldwide leaders in this field. We are actively looking for a 3D Graphics Engineer to join any of our US offices to support our FlexTerm group. FlexTerm is a real-time 3D industrial simulation platform where complex logistics systems are studied, designed, optimized, developed, and tested before being deployed into production. It allows to model any kind of system; however, it is mostly applied to highly automated facilities such as ports, container terminals, automated warehouses and factories, etc. These systems typically integrate infrastructure, equipment, people, automatic control systems, sensors, complex business logic, artificial intelligence, and machine learning to perform a common goal. As a Software Engineer, you will work closely with highly talented and experienced engineers to achieve the vision of FlexTerm in becoming the ultimate tool for planning, designing, and testing complex automated systems. About Moffatt & Nichol Moffatt & Nichol is a leading U.S.-based global infrastructure advisor specializing in the planning and design of facilities that shape and serve our coastlines, harbors and rivers, as well as an innovator in the transportation complexities associated with the movement of freight. For the 2 nd year in a row, Moffatt & Nichol is ranked Engineering News Record #1 for Marine & Port Facilities and Top 20 in Transportation. We were also named Southeast Design Firm of the Year 2023 Moffatt & Nichol's professional staff includes engineers, planners, and scientists who serve our global client base from offices in Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Pacific Rim. The firm provides clients worldwide with customized service and a level of excellence that have become the firm’s hallmark in several primary practice areas – ports and harbors; coastal, environmental and water resources; urban waterfronts and marinas; transportation, bridges and rail; inspection and rehabilitation; and energy. Duties and responsibilities: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions. Craft highly effective C++ code to develop and maintain the applications in the FlexTerm platform. Write unit and integration tests for new and existing functionality. Contribute to the overall platform vision, architecture, and design. Excel with agile development methodologies. Write technical documentation and user manuals in the team’s wiki site in Confluence. Other duties: Please note this job posting is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Qualifications: M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Computer Science or related discipline (Systems/Industrial Engineering, Electrical/Electronics/Computer Engineering, Mechatronics or Mechanical Engineering with emphasis in Robotics). Proven software development experience Minimum 3 years of experience as a software engineer. Proven education or experience in: Computer programming Data structures and algorithms Compilers Operating systems Database systems Networks and distributed systems Numerical methods 3D computer graphics and animation Lineal algebra and vector calculus Physics (Mechanics) Statistics and probability Operations research (mathematical programming/optimization) Discrete-event system simulation Desired experience in: Real-time metrics/BI systems AI/ML development Fluent in a C-like programming language such as C, C++, C#, Objective-C, Swift, Lua, Java, Javascript. Desired skills: Low level 3D/VR libraries such as OpenGL, GLSL, Vulkan. GUI frameworks such as Qt/ImGUI. Database systems such as Influx, Elastic, SQLServer and PostgreSQL DB, etc. Developing for multiple operating systems and devices: Windows, MacOS, Linux, iOS, Android. Developing and architecting end to end web services and applications. AI/ML frameworks such as Torch, TensorFlow, OpenCV. OS scripting languages such as MS-DOS batch, Sh and Powershell. Working with multiple exchange formats like XML, JSON, Protobuf. Working with version control systems such as Git, Gitlab and SourceTree. Working with cloud systems such as Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure. Automate software deployment to users (DevOps). Test-driven development processes and tools. All new hires will be required to successfully complete and pass a pre-employment (post offer) background check in compliance with NIST 800-171 Moffatt & Nichol uses E-Verify and employment is contingent upon the legal ability to obtain employment in the U.S. and to present the required documentation at hire Moffatt & Nichol EEO Statement As a global business, Moffatt & Nichol relies on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goal of Creative People, Practical Solutions® serving our client needs, and ensures nondiscrimination in all activities in accordance with Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964. We continuously seek talented, qualified employees in our world-wide operations regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, pregnancy, national origin, religion, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, protected veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Moffatt & Nichol is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer/ Federal Contractor desiring priority referrals of all protected veterans for job openings. EEO is the LAW If you need more information or require special assistance for persons with disabilities or limited English proficiency, please contact Human Resources at (562) 590-6500 or TTY/TDD users please call 711.

title: Software Engineer
description: Moffatt & Nichol specializes in large complex waterfront infrastructure projects and is recognized as one of the worldwide leaders in this field. We are actively looking for a Backend and DevOps engineer to join our any of our US offices to support our FlexTerm group. FlexTerm is a real-time 3D industrial simulation platform where complex logistics systems are studied, designed, optimized, developed, and tested before being deployed into production. It allows to model any kind of system; however, it is mostly applied to highly automated facilities such as ports, container terminals, automated warehouses and factories, etc. These systems typically integrate infrastructure, equipment, people, automatic control systems, sensors, complex business logic, artificial intelligence, and machine learning to perform a common goal. As a Software Engineer, you will work closely with highly talented and experienced engineers to achieve the vision of FlexTerm in becoming the ultimate tool for planning, designing, and testing complex automated systems. About Moffatt & Nichol Moffatt & Nichol is a leading U.S.-based global infrastructure advisor specializing in the planning and design of facilities that shape and serve our coastlines, harbors and rivers, as well as an innovator in the transportation complexities associated with the movement of freight. For the 2 nd year in a row, Moffatt & Nichol is ranked Engineering News Record #1 for Marine & Port Facilities and Top 20 in Transportation. We were also named Southeast Design Firm of the Year 2023. Moffatt & Nichol's professional staff includes engineers, planners, and scientists who serve our global client base from offices in Europe, North America, Latin America, and the Pacific Rim. The firm provides clients worldwide with customized service and a level of excellence that have become the firm’s hallmark in several primary practice areas – ports and harbors; coastal, environmental and water resources; urban waterfronts and marinas; transportation, bridges and rail; inspection and rehabilitation; and energy. Duties and responsibilities: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions. Craft highly effective Javascript/Typescript/C++ code to develop and maintain the cloud backend of the FlexTerm platform Write unit and integration tests for new and existing functionality Contribute to the overall platform vision, architecture, and design Excel with agile development methodologies Write technical documentation and user manuals in the team’s wiki site in Confluence Other duties: Please note this job posting is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Qualifications: M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Computer Science or related discipline (Systems/Industrial Engineering, Electrical/Electronics/Computer Engineering, Mechatronics or Mechanical Engineering with emphasis in Robotics). Minimum 3 years of experience as a software engineer Proven software development experience Proven education or experience in: Computer programming Data Structures and algorithms Compilers Operating systems Database systems Networks and Distributed Systems Computer Graphics Lineal Algebra Physics (Mechanics) Statistics and Probability Operations Research (mathematical programming/optimization) Desired experience in: Discrete-event system simulation 3D computer graphics and animation Real-time metrics/BI systems Fluent in a C-like programming language such as C, C++, C#, Objective-C, Swift, Lua, Java, Javascript/Typescript. Desired skills: Low level 3D/VR libraries such as OpenGL, GLSL, Vulkan. GUI frameworks such as Qt/ImGUI. Database systems such as Influx, Elastic, SQLServer and Oracle DB, DB2, etc. Developing for multiple operating systems and devices: Windows, MacOS, Linux, iOS, Android. Developing end-to-end web services and applications (using SOAP, REST APIs). Firsthand experience with front end web technologies such as: HTML5, DHTML, Stylesheets (CSS), JavaScript, Ajax, React and jQuery. OS scripting languages such as MS-DOS batch, Sh and Powershell. Working with multiple exchange formats like XML, JSON, Protobuf. Working with version control systems such as Git, Gitlab and SourceTree. Working with cloud systems such as Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure. Automate software deployment to users using CI/CD pipelines (DevOps).
